title: __radd__ for torch.utils.data.Dataset
body_html:
Existing __add__ is not enough for usage as in:

sum(dataset.get_subset(subset_name) for subset_name in ['train', 'val'])
# TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'int' and 'Subset'`)

(In practice I want to pull subset names dynamically by splitting a string by underscore)

__radd__ seems to fix this
body_text:
Existing __add__ is not enough for usage as in:
sum(dataset.get_subset(subset_name) for subset_name in ['train', 'val'])
# TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'int' and 'Subset'`)
(In practice I want to pull subset names dynamically by splitting a string by underscore)
__radd__ seems to fix this
body:
Existing `__add__` is not enough for usage as in:
```python
sum(dataset.get_subset(subset_name) for subset_name in ['train', 'val'])
# TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'int' and 'Subset'`)
```
(In practice I want to pull subset names dynamically by splitting a string by underscore)

`__radd__` seems to [fix this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1218710/pythons-sum-and-non-integer-values)
